meanings.sent1: The little dog let out a loud bark when the mailman arrived.
meanings.sent2: I heard a bark coming from the neighbor's yard as their dog played outside.
meanings.sent3: The bark of the dog startled the cat, making it jump up in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The bark echoed through the park, signaling the start of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The bark of the dog was so loud that it could be heard from far away.

meanings.definition: The tough protective outer covering of a tree
meanings.sent1: The rough bark of the oak tree provided shelter for insects.
meanings.sent2: I touched the bark of the pine tree and felt its rough texture.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel ran up the bark of the tree, searching for acorns.
meanings.sent4: The bark of the tree shielded the delicate inner layers from the harsh weather.
meanings.sent5: The bark of the tree was a natural armor, protecting it from harm.

meanings.sent1: The teacher had to bark at the noisy students to get their attention.
meanings.sent2: I didn't mean to bark at you; I was just feeling stressed.
meanings.sent3: The boss tends to bark orders when he's under pressure at work.
meanings.sent4: She tends to bark out commands like a drill sergeant when she's in a hurry.
meanings.sent5: The coach would bark instructions during the game to guide the players.
